data.title: Browse recent arrivals in Italian Cinema from Royal Books, Inc.
data.meta_description: Immoral Tales [Contés immoraux] (Original photograph from the 1973 anthology film). Neuilly-sur-Seine: Argos Films, 1973.  Vintage borderless reference photograph from the 1973 fi…
data.text:
Immoral Tales [Contés immoraux] (Original photograph from the 1973 anthology film)

by Walerian Borowczyk (director, screenwriter); Jean Baptiste de Boyer (novel); Valentine Penrose (poem); Lisa Danvers, Paloma Picasso, Charlotte Alexandra, Fabrice Luchini (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Neuilly-sur-Seine: Argos Films, 1973. Vintage borderless reference photograph from the 1973 film, showing actress Paloma Picasso, in costume as Countess Bathory, staring down at four nude women. Stamp specific to the film's French release on the verso. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$375.00

More Photos

Double Murder (Three original photographs from the 1977 film)

by Ursula Andress, Peter Ustinov, Marcello Mastroianni (starring); Ugo Moretti (novel); Steno (director, screenwriter); Agenore Incrocci, Furio Scarpelli (screenwriters)

Show Details

Description:

Burbank, CA: Warner Brothers, 1977. Three vintage reference photographs from the American release of the 1977 Italian film, all three showing actress Ursula Andress in the bath. A police commissioner teams up with a political activist to solve the murder of a prince. Set and shot on location in Rome. 10 x 8 inches.… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$375.00

More Photos

Investigation of a Citizen Above Suspicion [Indagine su un cittadino al di sopra di ogni sospetto] (Original photograph of Florinda Bolkan from the 1970 film)

by Elio Petri (director, screenwriter); Ugo Pirro (screenwriter); Florinda Bolkan, Gian Maria Volonté (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1970. Vintage borderless reference photograph from the 1970 film, showing actress Florinda Bolkan talking on the phone and smoking in the bath. Annotations in manuscript ink regarding cropping on the verso. A Kafkaesque satire about corruption in policing, about a high-ranking police inspector who kills his mistress and proceeds to cover up his involvement in… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$250.00

More Photos

We The Living [Noi Vivi] (Collection of original photographs and postcard photographs from the 1942 film)

by Ayn Rand (novel); Alida Valli, Rossano Brazzi, Fosco Giachetti (starring); Goffredo Alessandrini (director, screenwriter); Corrado Alvaro, Orio Vergani, Anton Giulio Majano, Oreste Biancoli (screenwriters)

Show Details

Description:

Rome and Los Angeles: Scalera Studios / Angelika Films, 1986. Collection of three vintage postcard photographs from the 1942 Italian film, and four vintage studio still photographs from the 1986 restoration and rerelease of the film. Of particular note among the studio still photographs is an image of writer Ayn Rand taken by Leonard McCombe, capturing Rand… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$350.00

The Conformist [Il conformista] (Original lobby card for the 1970 Italian film)

by Jean-Louis Trintignant, Stefania Sandrelli, Gastone Moschin, Dominique Sanda, Pierre Clémenti (starring); Bernardo Bertolucci (director)

Show Details

Description:

Los Altos, CA: Paramount Pictures, 1970. Vintage lobby card for the 1970 Italian film. Text in Italian. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg, Patti Smith, Salvador Dali, and many others.… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$125.00

More Photos

by Jean-Louis Trintignant, Stefania Sandrelli, Gastone Moschin, Dominique Sanda, Pierre Clémenti (starring); Bernardo Bertolucci (director)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: United International Pictures, 1970. Collection of eight vintage borderless lobby cards for the Spanish release of the 1970 Italian film. Text in Spanish. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg,… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$350.00

More Photos

Nazi Love Camp 27 [La Svastica en el Vientre] (Collection of 13 original lobby cards for Spanish release of the 1977 Italian film)

by Sirpa Lane, Renata Moar, Piero Lulli (starring); Mario Caiano as William Hawkins (director, screenwriter); Gianfranco Clerici, Sandro Amati (screenwriters)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: Arte 7, 1977. Collection of 13 vintage borderless lobby cards for the Spanish release of the 1977 Italian film. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg, Patti Smith, Salvador… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$85.00

Novecento [1900] (Original photograph of Bernardo Bertolucci on the set of the 1976 film)

by Bernardo Bertolucci (director, screenwriter); Franco Arcalli, Giuseppe Bertolucci (screenwriters); Robert De Niro, Gérard Depardieu, Burt Lancaster, Donald Sutherland (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1976. Vintage borderless reference photograph from the 1976 film, showing Bernardo Bertolucci talking with a woman on the set. A historical epic chronicling the friendship between two men in Italy in the first half of the twentieth century, through the rise of fascism and communism. One of the longest commercially released films, clocking in at 317… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$225.00

More Photos

Bad Girls Don't Cry [La Notte Brava] (Collection of five original lobby cards for the American release of the 1959 Italian film)

by Pier Paolo Pasolini (screenwriter); Tomas Milian, Laurent Terzieff, Elsa Martinelli, Antonella Lualdi (starring); Mauro Bolognini (director); Jacques-Laurent Bost (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

Los Angeles: Medallion Pictures, 1965. Collection of five vintage lobby cards for the American release of the 1959 Italian film. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg, Patti Smith, Salvador Dali,… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$125.00

The Garden of Eden [Il GIardino Dell'Eden] (Original pressbook for the 1980 Japanese-Italian film)

by Leonora Fani, Antonella Lualdi, Massimo Serato, Ronni Valente (starring); Yasuzô Masumura (director, screenwriter); Leros Pittoni (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

Japan: Herald Ace / Nippon Herald Films, 1980. Vintage pressbook for the 1980 film. A Japanese-Italian coproduction, with text in both Japanese and Italian. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg,… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$125.00

by Leonora Fani, Paola Senatore, Ugo Tognazzi (starring); Salvatore Samperi (director, screenwriter); Cesare Lanza (novel); Alessandro Parenzo (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

Rome: Columbia Pictures, 1977. Vintage lobby card for the 1977 Italian film. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg, Patti Smith, Salvador Dali, and many others. A graduate of the… Read more about this item

US$45.00

by Pier Paolo Pasolini (screenwriter); Mauro Bolognini (director); Alberto Moravia (screenwriter, novel); Marco Visconti (screenwriter); Lea Massari, Jean Sorel, Paolo Stoppa, Isabelle Corey (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Munich: Universum Film [UFA], 1960. Vintage borderless lobby card for the 1960 Italian film. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg, Patti Smith, Salvador Dali, and many others. A graduate… Read more about this item

by Leonora Fani, Paola Senatore, Ugo Tognazzi (starring); Salvatore Samperi (director, screenwriter); Cesare Lanza (novel); Alessandro Parenzo (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1978. Vintage lobby card for the German release of the 1977 Italian film. From the collection of artist and author Duncan Hannah. Duncan Hannah was a key figure in the burgeoning New York underground arts scene, befriending Andy Warhol and his superstars, Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg, Patti Smith, Salvador Dali, and many others. A… Read more about this item

The Reluctant Saint (Original photograph from the 1962 film)

by John Fante (screenwriter); Edward Dmytryk (director); Joseph Petracca (screenwriter); Maximilian Schell, Ricardo Montalban, Lea Padovani (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: Davis-Royal Films, 1962. Vintage studio still photograph from the 1962 film. "The Reluctant Saint" is the story of Giuseppe Desa (Maximilian Schell), a 17th century Franciscan friar and mystic, recognized as St. Joseph of Cupertino by the Catholic Church. Set in and shot on location in Rome. 8 x 10 inches. Very… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$15.00

More Photos

The Sisters [Le sorelle] (Collection of eleven original color photographs from the 1969 Italian film)

by Nathalie Delon, Susan Strasberg, Giancarlo Giannini (starring); Roberto Malenotti (director, screenwriter); Brunello Rondi (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1969. Collection of eleven vintage borderless color reference photographs from the 1969 Italian sexploitation film. Faced with a broken marriage, a woman decides to try to rekindle her incestuous relationship with her younger sister, who is herself happily married to a wealthy older man. 9.25 x 7 inches. Fine.

Item Price

US$375.00

More Photos

Marquis de Sade: Justine (Original photograph from the 1969 film)

by Romina Power, Maria Rohm, Klaus Kinski, Akim Tamiroff (starring); Jesús [Jess] Franco (director); Harry Alan Towers (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: Corona, 1969. Vintage borderless reference photograph from the 1969 film, showing actors Romina Power and Harald Leipnitz. Printed mimeo snipe in German affixed to the verso. Based on the 1791 novel by the Marquis de Sade, about two orphaned sisters whose lives diverge drastically as they come into adulthood. 9.5 x 7.25 inches. About… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$225.00

Casanova 70 (Original photograph of Beba Loncar from the 1965 film)

by Mario Monicelli (director, screenwriter); Agenore Incrocci, Furio Scarpelli, Tonino Guerra, Giorgio Salvioni, Suso Cecchi D'Amico (screenwriters); Marcello Mastroianni, Virna Lisi, Marisa Mell, Enrico Maria Salerno (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1965. Vintage reference photograph from the 1965 Italian film, showing actress Beba Loncar. Annotations in manuscript pencil and a provenance stamp on the verso. An army officer romances his way through Europe, with the caveat that he can only find romantic satisfaction in situations where his life is in danger. Set and shot on… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$250.00

More Photos

The Conformist [Il conformista] (Three original photographs from the 1970 Italian film)

by Jean-Louis Trintignant, Stefania Sandrelli, Gastone Moschin, Dominique Sanda, Pierre Clémenti (starring); Bernardo Bertolucci (director)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1970. Three vintage borderless reference photographs from the 1970 film. Two with the stamp of photographer Angelo Novi on the versos. A young upper-middle class Italian man joins Mussolini's Organization for Vigilance and Repression of Antifascism, and his first assignment is to assassinate his former teacher, a political dissident now residing in France. An intricate and… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$425.00

More Photos

French Cancan [Only the French Can] (Three original photographs of Jean Renoir on the set of the 1955 film)

by Jean Renoir (director, screenwriter); Jean Gabin, Françoise Arnoul, Maria Félix (starring); André-Paul Antoine (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1955. Three vintage reference photographs of director Jean Renoir on the set of the 1955 film, two showing Renoir with actress Françoise Arnoul, and one showing Renoir examining the ground while surrounded by cast members. All three photographs with Amsterdam distributor stamps on the versos. A dramatization of the opening of the famed Moulin Rouge nightclub,… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$325.00
